page.title: 08Saturday At School.
page.content: Every Saturday morning at 8.30am I get up and prepare for school. Normal school children don't go to school on Saturdays, but I do. {I go to my own {school on Saturdays to learn Italian because my mum and dad are Italian. I stay their for 45 minutes to learn, draw and speak. Most of the pupils have Italian parents but 3 or 4 have English ones. We read for 10 minutes then write for another 10 minutes. After that we go out to play while the teacher has a rest. When we come back in we answer questions out of our book and draw. After that we have a game of bingo or a spelling game in Italian. Altogether there are 6 children at the school. Saturdays are not the best day of the week for me! By CONCETTO TOZZI.
